author: Diana Richards
message:
Merge pull request #1802 from NamsooChoi-MSFT/patch-7

Exceptions for automatic hard deletion.md

{"content":"The following is the commit files that have changed: {
  "sha": "d516f493f6bf6cafa8317a1a14852c494997e2c5",
  "filename": "docs/architecture/recover-from-deletions.md",
  "status": "modified",
  "additions": 4,
  "deletions": 1,
  "changes": 5,
  "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/126680a68a8ebd69f9c2352afeb2717489013600/docs%2Farchitecture%2Frecover-from-deletions.md",
  "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/126680a68a8ebd69f9c2352afeb2717489013600/docs%2Farchitecture%2Frecover-from-deletions.md",
  "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Farchitecture%2Frecover-from-deletions.md?ref=126680a68a8ebd69f9c2352afeb2717489013600",
  "patch": "@@ -193,6 +193,9 @@ Moving from soft to hard delete:\n * A soft-deleted object isn't restored within 30 days.\n * An administrator intentionally deletes an object in the soft delete state.\n \n+>[!Note]\n+> Application objects are not hard deleted automatically even after 30 days when ‘signInAudience’ value of the apps are set to one of (\"AzureADMultipleOrgs\", \"AzureADandPersonalMicrosoftAccount\", or \"PersonalMicrosoftAccount\"). In this case, application objects should be manually hard deleted.\n+\n Directly hard deleted:\n \n * The object type that was deleted doesn't support soft delete.\n@@ -214,4 +217,4 @@ Make sure you have a process to regularly review items in the soft-delete state\n \n ## Next steps\n \n-Learn how to avoid unwanted deletions in, [Recoverability best practices](recoverability-overview.md).\n\\ No newline at end of file\n+Learn how to avoid unwanted deletions in, [Recoverability best practices](recoverability-overview.md)."
}. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary.","role":"user"}
ai_summary.Response: This commit updates the documentation on recovering from deletions in Microsoft Entra ID. It clarifies that application objects with specific `signInAudience` values (e.g., `AzureADMultipleOrgs`) are not automatically hard-deleted after 30 days and require manual deletion. This change aims to provide users with more precise information regarding application object lifecycle management.

author: Diana Richards
message:
Adding custom note markdown

Clarified note on application object deletion behavior.

ai_summary.Response: This commit modifies the documentation on recovering from deletions. The primary change is the reformatting of a note regarding the automatic hard deletion of application objects. Previously, the note was presented with a standard bulleted list, but it has now been converted to a `[!Note]` block, enhancing its visual prominence. Additionally, a minor grammatical correction was made to the sentence structure within the note.
